sqlparser.ERExtractor module¶

class sqlparser.ERExtractor.FieldPath(db, tb, fd)¶

Bases: object

Class for field path

sqlparser.ERExtractor.get_er_from_sql(default_db_name, sql)¶

This function gets entity relationship from one sql line.

Args:
default_db_name (unicode): The default database name. sql (unicode): The sql line to be parse.
Returns:
A list of pairs of FieldPath. For example: [(FieldPath(u’database0’, ‘table0’, ‘field0’), FieldPath(u’database0’, ‘table1’, ‘field1’))]

A way might be used is

>>> print get_er_from_sql(default_db_name = u'', sql = u'select a.id, b.name from db.ac a join db.bc b on a.id=b.id or a.id=b.iid where a.cnt > 10')
[(('db', 'ac', 'id'), ('db', 'bc', 'id')), (('db', 'ac', 'id'), ('db', 'bc', 'iid'))]
